intro: Phaseolus peduncularis f. pius, commonly known as the scarlet runner bean, is a cultivated variant of the common bean species. It is characterized by its vigorous climbing habit and large, showy flowers that are typically red or orange in color. The plant produces elongated, green pods that mature into dry, brown pods containing edible seeds. It thrives in warm climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. This variety is often grown for both its ornamental value and as a source of nutritious beans.
